pr_title: HADOOP-17324. Don't relocate org.bouncycastle in shaded client jars

timeline.message: HADOOP-17324. Don't relocate org.bouncycastle in shaded client jars

timeline.bodyText: another issue: we currently don't bundle YARN test resources like capacity-scheduler.xml in hadoop-client-minicluster so this is a temporary workaround. I'll open another JIRA for this later.
timeline.author: sunchao

replies.bodyText: we leave out all of test/resources to stop log4j files, site configs etc getting onto the classpath of apps downstream -so making it impossible for them to choose their own options
replies.author: steveloughran

replies.bodyText: maybe we should include them for test-only purpose? I think hadoop-client-minicluster should always be test scope right?
replies.author: sunchao

replies.bodyText: it may be test only, but the other test suite may have its own configs that it wants. If we put them in the test JAR, it becomes near impossible to change. People will hate us (more)
replies.author: steveloughran

timeline.bodyText: should go straight after line 45 - no gap
timeline.author: steveloughran

replies.bodyText: will fix. I was trying to follow the existing style though which separates imports based on package.
replies.author: sunchao

timeline.bodyText: all services are closeable, so use IOUtil.cleanupWithLogger() & let it handle null checks and exceptions
timeline.author: steveloughran

replies.bodyText: Nice. Didn't know this util method, but seems we can only use it with yarnCluster.
replies.author: sunchao
